verses.kjv: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east.
verses.ct: Jacob continued on his way and traveled to the land of the eastern peoples.

verses.kjv: And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great stone was upon the well’s mouth.
verses.ct: He noticed a well out in a field, and 3 flocks of sheep were lying near it. The flocks were watered from that well, and a large stone covered the opening.

verses.kjv: And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well’s mouth in his place.
verses.ct: When all the flocks had been gathered there, the shepherds would roll the stone off the well's opening, water the sheep, and then put the stone back in its place.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we.
verses.ct: Jacob asked them, "Friends, where are you from?" They answered, "We're from Haran."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him.
verses.ct: He asked them, "Do you know Laban, the grandson of Nahor?" They replied, "Yes, we know him."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well: and, behold, Rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep.
verses.ct: Then he asked, "Is he doing well?" They said, "He's doing well. And look — his daughter Rachel is coming right now with the sheep."

verses.kjv: And he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.
verses.ct: Jacob said, "It's still the middle of the day. It's not time to round up the animals yet. Why don't you water the sheep and take them back out to graze?"

verses.kjv: And they said, We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and till they roll the stone from the well’s mouth; then we water the sheep.
verses.ct: They explained, "We can't do that until all the flocks have arrived and the stone is rolled away from the well's opening. Only then do we water the sheep."

verses.kjv: And while he yet spake with them, Rachel came with her father’s sheep: for she kept them.
verses.ct: While he was still talking with them, Rachel arrived with her father's sheep, because she was the one who tended them.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother’s brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother’s brother.
verses.ct: When Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of his mother's brother Laban, along with Laban's flock, he went over, rolled the stone off the well's opening, and watered the flock of his uncle Laban.

verses.kjv: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.
verses.ct: Then Jacob kissed Rachel and broke down crying.

verses.kjv: And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s brother, and that he was Rebekah’s son: and she ran and told her father.
verses.ct: Jacob explained to Rachel that he was her father's relative — Rebekah's son. She ran and told her father.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister’s son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
verses.ct: As soon as Laban heard the news about his sister's son Jacob, he ran out to meet him, threw his arms around him, kissed him, and brought him home. Then Jacob told Laban everything that had happened.

verses.kjv: And Laban said to him, Surely thou art my bone and my flesh. And he abode with him the space of a month.
verses.ct: Laban said to him, "You really are my own flesh and blood!" Jacob stayed with him for a full month.

verses.kjv: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?
verses.ct: Then Laban said to Jacob, "Just because you're my relative doesn't mean you should work for me for nothing. Tell me — what should I pay you?"

verses.kjv: And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
verses.ct: Now Laban had 2 daughters. The older one was named Leah, and the younger one was named Rachel.

verses.kjv: Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured.
verses.ct: Leah had soft eyes, but Rachel had a beautiful figure and a lovely face.

verses.kjv: And Jacob loved Rachel; and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.
verses.ct: Jacob was in love with Rachel, so he said, "I'll work for you for 7 years in exchange for your younger daughter Rachel."

verses.kjv: And Laban said, It is better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another man: abide with me.
verses.ct: Laban replied, "I'd rather give her to you than to some stranger. Stay here with me."

verses.kjv: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.
verses.ct: So Jacob worked 7 years for Rachel, but they felt like only a few days to him because of how much he loved her.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her.
verses.ct: Then Jacob said to Laban, "My time is complete. Give me my wife so I can be with her."

verses.kjv: And Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
verses.ct: So Laban invited all the local men and hosted a feast.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.
verses.ct: But that evening, he took his daughter Leah and brought her to Jacob, and Jacob had relations with her.

verses.kjv: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid for an handmaid.
verses.ct: Laban also gave his servant Zilpah to his daughter Leah as her personal servant.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was Leah: and he said to Laban, What is this thou hast done unto me? did not I serve with thee for Rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?
verses.ct: When morning came, Jacob realized it was Leah! He confronted Laban: "What have you done to me? Didn't I work for you in exchange for Rachel? Why did you trick me?"

verses.kjv: And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
verses.ct: Laban answered, "It's not our custom here to marry off the younger daughter before the firstborn."

verses.kjv: Fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.
verses.ct: "Finish out this wedding week with Leah, and then I'll give you Rachel too — in exchange for another 7 years of work."

verses.kjv: And Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him Rachel his daughter to wife also.
verses.ct: Jacob agreed and completed the wedding week. Then Laban gave him his daughter Rachel as his wife as well.

verses.kjv: And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah his handmaid to be her maid.
verses.ct: Laban gave his servant Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her personal servant.

verses.kjv: And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.
verses.ct: Jacob also had relations with Rachel, and he loved Rachel more than Leah. He then worked for Laban another 7 years.

verses.kjv: And when the LORD saw that Leah was hated, he opened her womb: but Rachel was barren.
verses.ct: When the LORD saw that Leah was unloved, he allowed her to become pregnant, but Rachel remained unable to have children.

verses.kjv: And Leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Surely the LORD hath looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will love me.
verses.ct: Leah became pregnant and gave birth to a son. She named him Reuben, saying, "The LORD has seen my suffering. Surely now my husband will love me."

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Because the LORD hath heard that I was hated, he hath therefore given me this son also: and she called his name Simeon.
verses.ct: She became pregnant again and gave birth to another son. She said, "The LORD heard that I am unloved, so he gave me this son too." She named him Simeon.

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Now this time will my husband be joined unto me, because I have born him three sons: therefore was his name called Levi.
verses.ct: She became pregnant once more and gave birth to a son. She said, "This time my husband will feel close to me, because I've given him 3 sons." That is why he was named Levi.

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son: and she said, Now will I praise the LORD: therefore she called his name Judah; and left bearing.
verses.ct: She became pregnant again and gave birth to a son. She said, "This time I will praise the LORD." So she named him Judah. After that, she stopped having children.
